item.title: @elonmusk: Prompt Share: A beautiful young woman with dark hair in a loose updo, eyes closed in peaceful contem...
item.description: Prompt Share: A beautiful young woman with dark hair in a loose updo, eyes closed in peaceful contemplation, wearing an elegant one-shoulder flowing white gown with delicate golden floral embroidery and patterns, sitting relaxed on stone steps in ancient ruins with weathered stone columns and arches, a faded blue wooden door behind her, a large terracotta vase filled with tall dry pampas grass or wheat beside her, warm golden hour sunlight casting soft shadows, highly detailed oil painting style with visible brushstrokes, serene atmosphere, intricate textures, masterpiece, ultra detailed.

item.title: @elonmusk: I totally agree. For decades, our schools have focused on the moral failings of the West. Students l...
item.description: I totally agree. For decades, our schools have focused on the moral failings of the West. Students learn little about the West‚Äôs far more numerous and spectacular moral achievements. This imbalance has created a dangerous ethical illiteracy.

item.title: @elonmusk: Great quote from Cicero: ‚ÄùA nation can survive its fools, and even the ambitious. But it cannot surv...
item.description: Great quote from Cicero: ‚ÄùA nation can survive its fools, and even the ambitious. But it cannot survive treason from within. An enemy at the gates is less formidable, for he is known and he carries his banners openly. But the traitor moves among those within the gate freely, his sly whispers rustling through all the galleys, heard in the very hall of government itself. For the traitor appears not traitor - he speaks in the accents familiar to his victims, and wears their face and their garments, and he appeals to the baseness that lies deep in the hearts of all men. He rots the soul of a nation - he works secretly and unknown in the night to undermine the pillars of a city - he infects the body politic so that it can no longer resist. A murderer is less to be feared.‚Äù
